name: Butternut Squash Carbonara
description: This Vegan Butternut Squash Carbonara is a dairy-free spin on the traditional Italian Carbonara recipe with a creamy cashew cheese butternut squash carbonara sauce! Serve with crispy roasted smoky bacon-ish tofu. Options for Nutfree Glutenfree Soyfree

video.name: VEGAN BUTTERNUT SQUASH CARBONARA RECIPE| Vegan Richa Recipes by Richa Hingle
video.description:
Vegan Butternut Squash Carbonara recipe with smoky tofu 

Get the WRITTEN RECIPE here— https://www.veganricha.com/vegan-butternut-squash-carbonara/

SUBSCRIBE HERE: https://www.youtube.com/veganricharecipes?sub_confirmation=1

This Vegan Butternut Squash Carbonara is a dairy-free spin on the traditional Italian Carbonara recipe with a creamy cashew cheese butternut squash carbonara sauce! Serve with crispy roasted smoky bacon-ish tofu.

This easy vegan Butternut Squash Carbonara is the perfect fall and winter dinner. It’s a creamy spin on my popular Pumpkin Sage pasta and trust me, it will likely become a staple you will make again and again. Traditional Italian Carbonara Sauce is made from parmesan cheese and egg yolks.  This vegan version is just as deliciously rich and creamy (even without egg or dairy), thanks to cashew cream, and even quite cheesy thanks to nutritional yeast, and a hearty thanks to miso paste and fresh sage!

******MORE DINNER RECIPES FROM THE BLOG******

PUMPKIN SAGE PASTA: https://www.veganricha.com/vegan-pumpkin-sage-pasta/

PUMPKIN MAC AND CHEESE BAKE: https://www.veganricha.com/vegan-pumpkin-mac-and-cheese-bake/

JALAPENO CHILI CORNBREAD CASSEROLE: https://www.veganricha.com/jalapeno-chili-cornbread-casserole/

COOKBOOKS BY RICHA HINGLE (VEGAN RICHA): https://www.veganricha.com/mybooks/

recipeIngredient: 7 oz  firm or extra firm tofu (pressed for at least 15 minutes, and then drained and cubed into 1/4th inch cubes)

recipeInstructions.text: Add oil to a skillet over medium heat, add in the onion and garlic and cook until transluent.
recipeInstructions.name: Add oil to a skillet over medium heat, add in the onion and garlic and cook until transluent.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the sage and pepper flakes and mix in. Add in the butternut squash and cook until the butternut squash starts to get golden on some edges. This may not happen if you're using frozen butternut squash.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the sage and pepper flakes and mix in. Add in the butternut squash and cook until the butternut squash starts to get golden on some edges. This may not happen if you're using frozen butternut squash.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the rest of the ingredients under sauce, and cover and mix well. Then cover and cook for 10-12 minutes or until the butternut squash is tender to preference.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the rest of the ingredients under sauce, and cover and mix well. Then cover and cook for 10-12 minutes or until the butternut squash is tender to preference.

recipeInstructions.text: Take off heat and let the mixture cool a bit before adding to a blender and blending until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Take off heat and let the mixture cool a bit before adding to a blender and blending until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile make your fettuccine according to instructions on the package and cook until al dente, then combine the sauce to the fettuccine in a bowl, or you can also add it to a skillet to reheat, and cook it a little bit more. This helps thicken the sauce and also melds the flavors together
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile make your fettuccine according to instructions on the package and cook until al dente, then combine the sauce to the fettuccine in a bowl, or you can also add it to a skillet to reheat, and cook it a little bit more. This helps thicken the sauce and also melds the flavors together

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile, make the smoky tofu by combining the cubed tofu with the oil, soy sauce, smoked paprika, garlic, and maple syrup in a bowl to coat really well.
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile, make the smoky tofu by combining the cubed tofu with the oil, soy sauce, smoked paprika, garlic, and maple syrup in a bowl to coat really well.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread out the tofu on a parchent-ined baking sheet. Spread it out so that most of the cubes are not touching each other. Preheat the oven to 425 F (218 c ) then add the baking sheet to the oven when it's heated up. Bake for 10 minutes, then move it around, and then bake for another few minutes, and then keep an eye on the tofu. Take it out once the pieces start to get dry-ish and crunchy. The tofu can burn easily, so keep an eye after 14-15 minute mark. Serve the tofu on top of the butternut squash fettuccine.To store, keep the topping separate from the pasta and refrigerate for upto 3 days.,
